intro: Kyllinga geminiflora, commonly known as the twin-flowered spikerush, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its upright, grass-like stems and small, clustered inflorescences that produce tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Its leaves are typically narrow and have a slightly rough texture. Kyllinga geminiflora thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along the edges of water bodies.
